QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Venogram
QAPair.Answer: A venogram is a way to look at veins in your body. It uses x-rays and a radiographic contrast material. It is most often used to look at veins in the legs and belly area (abdomen). Veins are not normally seen in an x-ray. That is why the contrast material is used. The health care provider injects this dye into a vein so it shows up better on x-rays. Related topics include: Renal venogram , Leg venogram ,
